site_description: A comprehensive database for the fission yeast Schizosaccharomyces pombe, providing structural and functional annotation, literature curation and access to large-scale data sets
welcome_message: Comprehensive, curated, connected genomic, genetic and molecular data for Schizosaccharomyces pombe

footer.funders: PomBase is funded by the Wellcome Trust, run by a consortium comprising the University of Cambridge, University College London, and hosted by the Babraham Institute.

feature_location_warnings.warning: Many lncRNAs are cryptic and the functions (if any) are mostly unknown. RNA-seq cannot precisely map transcription start and termination sites, hence features are currently approximate. Most lncRNAs in fission yeast are induced in certain conditions, like non-dividing cells and meiotic differentiation. In proliferating cells, most lncRNAs are suppressed by RNA-processing pathways. For more details on the relevance of a specific RNA please follow the link to the source(s) (adjacent). You can also inspect individual datasets as tracks in JBrowse.

topDescription.text: Shortcuts for commonly used queries
Enter or upload a list of systematic gene IDs or gene names
UniProt accession mapping has moved
Retrieve genes via annotated Gene Ontology terms that describe the activity, process, or location of their products (protein or ncRNA)
Retrieve genes based on mutant phenotypes annotated using Fission Yeast Phenotype Ontology (FYPO)
Retrieve genes for which the curated human ortholog is associated with a disease. To find all disease gene orthologs, search for "disease"
Retrieve genes based on product type. Note that "protein" includes dubious and transposon protein-coding genes; there is a prepared query that excludes both in the list of commonly used queries
Retrieve protein-coding genes based on modifications annotated using PSI-MOD ontology terms
Retrieve protein domains, features and motifs
Retrieve protein-coding genes based on features annotated using the protein sequence feature branch of the Sequence Ontology (SO)

subNodes.extraDescription: Examples: short motifs such as NLS or KEN box, signal peptide, mitochondrial targeting signal, cleaved region
subNodes.extraDescription2: Use "sequence feature" to retrieve all genes with annotated sequence features

topDescription.text: Retrieve protein-coding genes by specific domains present in the products. To retrieve all domain-containing proteins, search for "IPR*" or "PF*"
Retrieve protein-coding genes by number of predicted transmembrane domains in the product

subNodes.percent_display_name: percentage of residues in coiled coil regions

topDescription.text: Retrieve protein-coding genes by number of predicted coiled-coil domains in the product or by percentage of residues in coiled-coil regions

subNodes.percent_display_name: percentage of residues in disordered regions

topDescription.text: Retrieve protein-coding genes by number of disordered regions in the product or by percentage of residues in disordered regions

subNodes.percent_display_name: percentage of residues in low complexity regions

topDescription.text: Retrieve protein-coding genes by number of low complexity regions in the product or by percentage of residues in low complexity regions
Retrieve protein properties
Retrieve protein-coding genes by product length (in amino acids)
Retrieve protein-coding genes by product molecular weight in kDa
Transcript and exons properties
Retrieve genes by number of exons in the primary transcript
Retrieve genes by number of transcript isoforms
Retrieve genes by spliced RNA length in nucleotides (not including UTRs for protein coding genes)
Retrieve genes by un-spliced RNA length in nucleotides (not including UTRs for protein coding genes)
Retrieve genes in a specified region of a chromosome
Orthologs and conservation
Retrieve protein-coding genes based on broad categories of taxonomic conservation
Retrieve proteins that have an ortholog in
Retrieve protein-coding genes based on

cc_goslim_pombe.description: S. pombe high level GO cellular component terms
cc_goslim_pombe.slim_results_description: A "GO slim" is a subset of the Gene Ontology terms selected for a specific purpose in interpreting the functional annotations in an entire organism, or a gene product list derived from an experiment.

bp_goslim_pombe.description: S. pombe high level GO biological process terms
bp_goslim_pombe.slim_results_description: A "GO slim" is a subset of the Gene Ontology terms selected for a specific purpose in interpreting the functional annotations in an entire organism, or a gene product list derived from an experiment.  PomBase has created a GO slim to provide a simple summary of S. pombe's biological capabilities by grouping gene products using broad biological process classifiers.

fypo_slim.description: High level fission yeast phenotype terms
fypo_slim.slim_results_description: A "slim" is a high-level subset of terms from an ontology, used to analyze sets of annotated genes. PomBase has created a slim from the Fission Yeast Phenotype Ontology (FYPO) to provide a summary of fission yeast phenotypes.

pombe_mondo_slim.slim_results_description: A "slim" is a high-level subset of terms from an ontology, used to analyze sets of annotated genes. PomBase has created a slim from the Mondo Disease Ontology (Mondo) to provide a simple summary of S. pombe genes with human orthologs implicated in disease.
